bibl.title: Chin Hing v. United States of America. Raply to Return to Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States District Court Western District of Washington Northern Division
In the Matter of the Application of Ching Hing for a Writ of Habeas Corpus } NO. 28752857 Reply to Return to Writ of Habeas Corpus

Comes now John J. Sullivan, as attorney for petition of Chin Hing, and in reply to the affirmative matter set up in the return to Writ of Habeas Corpus, admits the allegations therein up to and including the word "China" in line 20, and denies each and every allegaiton thereafter.
Wherefore, Petitioner prays that he be discharged.
div1.ab: John J Sullivan Atty for Petitioner
div1.p: The United States of America Western District of Washington Nothern Division } ss

John J Sullivan, being first duly sworn on oath, deposes and says: That he is attorney for the Petitioner herein; that he has read the foregoing reply to the return to the Writ of Habeas, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and Sworn to before me this 10 day of April, 1915. Adam Beilis

figure.ab: Seal of the State of Washington Notary Public

div1.p: In the Superior Court State of Washington King County
In re Application of Ching Hing for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Reply to Return to Writ of Habeas Corpus
Beeler & Sullivan Lawyers 510-11 White Building Seattle, Wash.
Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington Northern Divison APR 21 1915 Frank L Crosby, Clerk, by EML Deputy 2x
Copy of within Reply & Return to Writ of Habeas Corpus recieved and due service of same acknowledged this 21st day of April 1915
div1.ab: Winter S Martin Attorney for Asst US Atty
